title: The color depth of the digital camera in my (cheap) phone seems to have spontaneously dropped. How could this happen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Assuming it isn’t actually user error, the most likely culprit would be a software error related to exposing and processing the image. A different camera app may fix it, however that’s a bit unlikely as the error likely is a driver thing. It could be hardware related, but that’s more of a long shot, the camera would more likely simply not work at all.

Mobile phones can't have their bit depth easily changed, like some DSLR cameras. They simply lack both hardware and software resources to do so. Maybe you can provide your phone specs and some sample images, so I can give you a better answer.
